# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import torch
import torch.nn as nn

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    """
    Optimized model using channels_last_3d memory format for efficient 3D operations.
    Performs transposed 3D convolution, scalar multiplication, max pooling, 
    global average pooling, and clamping.
    """
    def __init__(self, in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, stride, padding, scale, maxpool_kernel_size):
        super(ModelNew, self).__init__()
        self.conv_transpose = nn.ConvTranspose3d(in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, stride=stride, padding=padding)
        # Convert to channels_last format for performance
        self.conv_transpose = self.conv_transpose.to(memory_format=torch.channels_last_3d)
        self.scale = scale
        self.maxpool = nn.MaxPool3d(kernel_size=maxpool_kernel_size)
        self.global_avg_pool = nn.AdaptiveAvgPool3d((1, 1, 1))
        self.clamp_min = 0
        self.clamp_max = 1

    def forward(self, x):
        # Convert to channels_last_3d memory format
        x = x.contiguous(memory_format=torch.channels_last_3d)
        x = self.conv_transpose(x)
        x = x * self.scale
        x = self.maxpool(x)
        x = self.global_avg_pool(x)
        x = torch.clamp(x, min=self.clamp_min, max=self.clamp_max)
        return x

batch_size = 128
in_channels = 3
out_channels = 16
depth, height, width = 16, 32, 32
kernel_size = 3
stride = 2
padding = 1
scale = 0.5
maxpool_kernel_size = 2

def get_inputs():
    return [torch.randn(batch_size, in_channels, depth, height, width)]

def get_init_inputs():
    return [in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, stride, padding, scale, maxpool_kernel_size]
# =================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-END ===================
